SENT.plain: Sinus venous thrombosis is a rare and severe disease, clinically characterised by headache, nausea, vomiting, focal deficits and epileptical seizures
We describe a case of sinus venous thrombosis 7 days post partum in a 21-year old woman
The pathogenesis symptoms, diagnosis and therapy are discussed
Advice for obstetric and gynaecological treatment after sinus venous thrombosis is given
